column4: I'd like some input on my upgrade path. A lot has been said about Unity, mostly involving hair being torn out. I'm using an early netbook so unity is out of the picture most likely, i'm actually interested in trying out E17.. which for some reason is not available for Lucid. I'm considering a fresh install of Kubuntu 11.10 and then changing desktop - would that be a good route or is there some other quirks I should be aware of?
Gnome was eating enough resources to irk me, I have XFCE in right now.
It is.. I'm having the usual "an update just came out" problems at the moment, and i'm considering some other tweaks.
nothing says you have to update everytime an update comes out
I haven't been. I think I still have holdovers from 2008 in here.
Well, i've been wanting to try E, but there's no Lucid package for it.
Yeah.. It's a high risk high reward decision they made. We won't really see how it worked till the next LTR, I think.
is your intallation you've got now stable and does everything you need>

My i8mpression of Unity was that they felt the need to compete with what Win and Apple were aiming at, not what was existing, and they had 2 years till the next LTR, so they jumped for it hoping that when 12.04LTS comes out, Unity will be stable and useful.
11.10 has a lot of people with broken driver setups
As noted, mostly I wanted to test out E, to see if it fits my tastes better. But it doesn't work for Lucid.
I suppose I could just kick it up to Maverick..
Anyhow, I also need to set up my other laptop, and everything I hear about Unity has been bad. also when I ran it on that laptop it gave me a monitor flicker.
I'm sure you'll have the chance to try Enlightenment at some point. I've used it, my impression were that the eye candy didn't really make it more useful, and maybe was distracting
ok. Anyhow my main issue is that I have 2 computers, one reportedly needs Oneiric to run (though straight Ubuntu caused an odd monitor behavior) and the other is a lightweight.
I get an impression that K is a bit less aggressive. I don't wanr to have to put Oneiric on my work laptop and then get stuck fighting with Unity glitches and immaturities.
Or should I just jump for Oneiric on the new computer and trust that they can get it sorted in the next week or two?
I wouldn't necessarily trust for that to happen
